It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves that form dense, mat-like structures on tree trunks or branches. The plant produces small, clustered sporangia on the undersides of its fronds, which are typically found in shaded, humid environments. Lindsaea schlechtendalii thrives in high-altitude cloud forests, where it relies on atmospheric moisture for nourishment. Its unique growth habit and ecological niche make it an important component of tropical forest biodiversity.
